# Images

## How to insert an image in html

![img](https://www.homeandlearn.co.uk/WD/images/chapter3/template_html.gif)

### height and width

![img](https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Set-Image-Width-and-Height-Using-HTML-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/v4-460px-Set-Image-Width-and-Height-Using-HTML-Step-2-Version-3.jpg.webp)

- The `<img>` element is used to add images to a web page.
- You must always specify a src attribute to indicate the source of an image and an alt attribute to describe the content of an image.
- You should save images at the size you will be using them on the web page and in the appropriate format.
- Photographs are best saved as JPEGs; illustrations or logos that use flat colors are better saved as GIFs.

![img](https://data-flair.training/blogs/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2020/07/Html-Tables.jpg)

![img](https://www.guru99.com/images/image019(1).png)

- The `<table>` element is used to add tables to a web page.
- A table is drawn out row by row. Each row is created with the `<tr>` element.
- Inside each row there are a number of cells represented by the `<td>` element (or `<th>` if it is a header).
- You can make cells of a table span more than one row or column using the rowspan and colspan attributes.
- For long tables you can split the table into a `<thead>`, `<tbody>`, and `<tfoot>`.

![img](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/BR4PM5WGm9o/maxresdefault.jpg)
![img](https://i.pinimg.com/236x/e1/9d/d7/e19dd77f5f63105d6c726744e58af6e0--typography-terms-type-anatomy.jpg)

### text transform

### text decoration

![img](data:image/png;base64,)

### text align

![img](https://www.tutorialandexample.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/image-434.png)

### text shadow

![img](https://image.slidesharecdn.com/refreshdc-html5css3-090719085307-phpapp01/95/up-to-speed-on-html-5-and-css-3-48-728.jpg?cb=1252999046)

- There are properties to control t XX he choice of font, size, weight, style, and spacing.
- There is a limited choice of fonts that you can assume most people will have installed.
- If you want to use a wider range of typefaces there are several options, but you need to have the right license to use them.
- You can control the space between lines of text, individual letters, and words. Text can also be aligned to the left, right, center, or justified. It can also be indented.
- You can use pseudo-classes to change the style of an element when a user hovers over or clicks on text, or when they have visited a link.
